H0.text: Charles Lindbergh became famous by flying which aeroplane. Spirit of St. Louis II

H1.text: Charles Lindbergh became famous by flying which aeroplane. Boeing 314

H2.text: Charles Lindbergh became famous by flying which aeroplane. Lockheed Vega

H3.text: Charles Lindbergh became famous by flying which aeroplane. NX211

A4.text: Lindbergh subsequently flew the Spirit of St. Louis to Belgium and England before President Calvin Coolidge sent the light cruiser Memphis to bring them back to the United States.

A5.text: The Spirit of St. Louis (formally the Ryan NYP; registered N-X-211) is the custom-built, single-engine, single-seat, high-wing monoplane that Charles Lindbergh flew on May 20â€“21, 1927, on the first solo nonstop transatlantic flight from Long Island, New York, to Paris, France, for which Lindbergh won the $25,000 Orteig Prize.
